Description: Red jasper sealstone. An exceptionally clear profile portrait, with long, tousled hair, the locks carefully delineated, and no beard. The nose is hooked, the slightly open mouth downturned, and the chin prominent. The features resemble those of Mark Antony on some of his coin portraits, and the bust ends at the neck.
Curator's comments: Walker & Higgs 2001 Sydenham 1528, a denarius issued in 39 BC and now in the collections of the Musei Capitolini, Rome, is particularly close to this intaglio. BIBLIOGRAPHY: S. Walker and A. Burnett, Augustus, British Museum Occasional Papers 16 (London 1981), 16-17, no. 174 (bibl).
Bibliographic references: Gem / Catalogue of Engraved Gems & Cameos, Greek, Etruscan & Roman in the British Museum (1966)
Walker & Higgs 2001 / Cleopatra of Egypt: from History to Myth (264)
Exhibition history: 2018 23 Feb – 22 Apr, Nashville, Frist Art Museum, 'Rome; City &Empire' 2018-2019 20 Sep-04 Feb, Canberra, National Museum of Australia, 'Rome; City &Empire' 2021 13 Feb-15 Aug, Belgium, Tongeren, Gallo-Romeins Museum, 'Rome; City & Empire' 2021-2022 25 Sep – 08 Oct, China, Suzhou Museum, 'Rome: City & Empire'
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Louis, Duc de Blacas d'Aulps
